He is one of many thousands of Iraqi asylum seekers who have been granted refugee status in Germany since the war began in 2003. In his case the government has no right under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act to prevent him from being a Canadian citizen. The passport has been in his possession since he was arrested at the airport in Munich, according to the German Interior Ministry. The passport that Mahmoud Fawzi carries is a German passport issued in 2009. He says his father, a Turkish man in his late 50s, was a German-Turkish dual citizen and was not in Germany on the day he disappeared. He says his parents were living in Germany and his father had been working for the German foreign affairs ministry.
